484865dd-b2d7-44af-87ba-abc214f5e055: A petrified character has been turned to stone and is considered {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}unconscious{/g}.
60d3ef68-1c04-4e37-b73d-2563ca9e0c84: A {g|ConditionFrightened}frightened{/g} creature flees from the source of its fear as best it can. If it's unable to flee, it may fight, but a frightened creature suffers a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability checks{/g}.
f91434aa-00af-499b-b138-f11c58ed8d6d: A {g|ConditionShaken}shaken{/g} character suffers a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability checks{/g}. Shaken is a less severe state of fear than {g|ConditionFrightened}frightened{/g} or panicked.
0f2ffcc4-5d8e-47f8-8bdd-85c532bb0cdd: At 1st level, a magus learns to cast {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and wield his weapons at the same time. This functions much like two-weapon fighting, but the off-hand weapon is a spell that is being cast. To use this ability, the magus must have one hand free, while wielding a light or {g|Encyclopedia:Light_Weapon}one-handed{/g} melee weapon in the other hand. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Full_Round_Action}full-round action{/g}, he can make all of his {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} with his melee weapon at a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} and can also cast any spell from the magus spell list with a {g|Encyclopedia:Casting_Time}casting time{/g} of 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} (any attack roll made as part of this spell also takes this penalty).
cd8a5651-f308-4063-8984-757459a7e888: Character is at the {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}death{/g}'s door, and escaped a deadly blow only by sheer luck. If their {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} fall below their negative {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} score again, then they will truly die. This condition can be removed by visiting a healer at the safe spot or by {g|SpellsRestorationGreater}Greater Restoration{/g}.
a1278bf5-44b8-41f9-ad5c-1b1f579b6125:
Charging is a special {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g} that allows you to move up to double your normal {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} during the same action.
You must move before your attack, not after. You must move at least 10 feet, directly toward the designated opponent.
You must have a clear path toward the opponent.
After moving, you may make a single {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g}. You get a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on the attack roll and take a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} until the beginning of your next turn.
d9c9c742-d404-4616-8789-98e5eeb6955b:
Charging is a special {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g} that allows you to move up to double your normal {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} during the same action.
You must move before your attack, not after. You must move at least 10 feet, directly toward the designated opponent.
You must have a clear path toward the opponent.
After moving, you may make a single {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g}. You get a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on the attack roll and take a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} until the beginning of your next turn.
4806db3e-7fe9-49ab-a95d-a74e301ce0c2: Instead of a melee weapon, an eldritch archer must use a ranged weapon for {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} combat. She doesn't need a free hand for ranged spell combat. The eldritch archer cannot accept an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to gain a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration checks{/g} to cast a spell defensively.
f0d82e7a-7e51-4b2e-93fe-6077f9bbbe9b: The character suffers a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability checks{/g}.
12f4f4e9-9d2e-42cc-8fb2-b519ed1bd0a2: This character's armor is temporarily disabled. It provides no benefits, as if the character wasn't wearing it. The armor itself is not damaged, and will work as usual after the battle ends.
fc324b4a-3f37-4649-8a6f-eacc07e3e0c3: This character's {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g} is decreased. It can be restored by {g|Encyclopedia:Rest}resting{/g}, or with the help of {g|SpellsRestorationLesser}lesser restoration{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} or some more powerful magic. A character whose ability score decreases to 0, dies.
95b14b08-66ed-44a6-b91f-22522f75183d: This character's {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g} is decreased. It can only be restored with the help of {g|SpellsRestoration}restoration{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} or some more powerful magic ({g|Encyclopedia:Rest}resting{/g} or {g|SpellsRestorationLesser}lesser restoration{/g} spell won't help). A character whose ability score decreases to 0, dies.
271f7241-b1a9-4883-bd95-8950c693635c: When a character is entangled, they can only move at half {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g}, they cannot run or charge, and they suffer a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and a –4 penalty to {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}. An entangled character who attempts to cast a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} must pass a {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration check{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 15 + spell level), or lose the spell.
